sentence.Network_en: Again and again passages in his essays exasperate or bewilder.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的文章里使人忿然或困惑的章节屡见不鲜.

sentence.Network_en: He had begun to exasperate her at last.
He shouted in an exasperate voice.

list.abs: To rouse to exasperation or anger ; provoke ., 使恼火 ; 激怒激起愤怒或恼怒 ; 煽动.
It showed the trend with the exasperate terms of trade of the developing country ., 它说明了发展中国家的贸易条件恶化的趋势.
This is an exasperating problem ., 这是一个棘手的难题.

because this is when arrangement ward , if arrive carelessly the mood of this kind of patient , can make an illness exasperate instead , the time of defer heal .因此在安排病房时，假如不注重到这种病人的心情，反而会使病情恶化，延迟痊愈的时间。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin exasperat- 'irritated to anger', from the verb exasperare (based on asper 'rough')

entry.def: If someone or something exasperates you, they annoy you and make you feel frustrated or upset.

example.ex: The sheer futility of it all exasperates her.
example.tran: 它毫无用处，这让她很生气。

auth_sentence.content: This tender assurance served only to exasperate Aunt Catherine.

sentences.en: We were exasperated at his ill behaviour.
sentences.cn: 我们对他的恶劣行为感到非常恼怒。
